head.title: Journal of a Passage in a Canoe from Pais Plat in Lake Superior to Portage de l'Isle in River Ouinipique, 1784. - Page #26

body.p: << First Page | < Previous Page | Page #26 of 32 | Next Page > | Last Page >>

td.p: Umfreville, Edward. Journal of a Passage in a Canoe from Pais Plat in Lake Superior to Portage de l'Isle in River Ouinipique, 1784. An electronic transcription. MFTP #0030

div.p: to a pt on Lt – then turn'd upon the Lt ¾ to a smooth rocky Isle in the Channel – from this a lac SWbW3½ to the pt of a large Id on Rt – pass'd 1 Island on Lt & a bay on Rt – then WbS3 to a rocky Pt on Rt – pass'd near 3 rod rocks on Lt having a long streight view forward – from the rocky pt turn'd gradually to ye Lt abt 1m. 'till a round I. appears in view in another Channel on the Lt sevl bays & large Islands on both sides, opposite to the rod Isld is a point on Lt with woods & rocks on it, after the mile mentd 5 more to the pt here are sevl other Isls on Rt but the one alluded to as a Guide in the Co is rod & rocky with woods on it – from the pt on Lt SSW4m. to a high pt of Green woods on the main on Lt pass'd 2 bays on Lt spacious lac & Iss on Rt – then entd the River again, went in it 2½m. to Rapid Carribou Port. 47yds over a smooth rock on Rt – From the Port. SbW1m. to 1st turning on Rt then in a streight Channel of a lac, between the main on Rt & Is on Lt 2½m. So to the pt of an Island on Rt – same Co 1m. to the smooth pt of a rocky Isld on Rt – then SbW2½ to the extreme pt of a large Isld on Rt – turn'd the pt of this Isld on Rt then So3m. to the extreme pt of of another large Isld on Rt turn'd ye pt of this Isld on Rt which is rocky & fell into Rivirere Ouinipique, & went SW to the pt of an Isld on Rt 1m. passing near another on Lt – then WbS3m. to a pt on Rt an I on Lt opposite, many large Is on both sides, then Wt 2m. to a pt on Rt passing a rock on Lt & sevl Iss on Lt turn'd ye pt & went along the end of the Isld 1m. – then NWbN1½ to a smooth rocky pt on Lt turn'd the pt & went NWbW1½ to a smooth rocky pt on Lt then same Co to a high Pt on Rt 2½m. opposite to wch is a red rock, being Port. de l'Ile the place of our Destination[.]

July 24 Saturday. Fine weather all day. Having necessary affairs to arrange, we staid here to-day, & the men having behav'd exceeding well during the voyage, We gave 'em a treat of the best we could afford.
25 Sunday. [M]e & St Germaine employ'd bringing up our Journals, which having finish'd, mean to depart To-morrow towards le Grand Portage.

26 Monday. Left Portage de l'Isle & went 34m. to Portage la Cave, length of the Port. 50yds – thence to Port. de Tête Blanche abt 250yds, length of the Portage 270yds – then to a discharge 2 miles, over it 50yds – then cross'd ye River to Port – a Cataract being above it, length of the Port. 146yds – then went ¾ of a mile to a discharge over it 6yds – then to Portage – having in the way 2 smart Rapids 4 miles length of the Port. 170yds – then went towards Portage du Rat 17 miles.

27 Tuesday. Left our encampment & proceeded abt 1 mile, when we came to 2 Tents of Indians, from whom we Traded some Sturgeon &c. which with some Traded yesterday, amounts to abt 6 days. [W]e afterwds met 8 Canoes more, returng

td.p:
L E G E N D :
in red , modifications made by the editor(s).
in lavender , modifications made by the assumed author(s).
